intro: Heteroneuron argutum, commonly known as the rough hawksbeard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is known for its yellow-orange inflorescence. Its leaves are rough and hairy, giving it its common name, while its seeds are dispersed by wind. Heteroneuron argutum is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
